46:10 Caption: The end of the first half.
46:59 Caption: It's a wonderful experience for every football lover to behold this hugely entertaining encounter. The players are performing at a high level, making the game very attractive. The game is quite balanced. The home team tries to find the weakness in the opposition's defence, especially with rapid counter-attacks, while the away team play possession football.

47:27 Caption: Ever Banega (Inter) takes the corner, but he overhits it and none of his teammates are able to reach the ball.
47:49 Caption: Juan Jesus (AS Roma) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Luca Banti blows for a foul. Inter are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.

48:13 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
48:59 Caption: What an entertaining encounter between these two teams. Let's hope there will more of the same in their other games. The game was quite balanced and neither team had any obvious advantage. The home team attempted to leave the opposition defence outnumbered and hit them on the break. The visitors tried to keep the ball on the ground and play a passing game.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
AS Roma hosted Inter in what turned out to be an exhilarating encounter, with the final scoreline of 2-1 in favor of the home team. The match saw a fascinating blend of attacking flair, defensive solidity, and tactical battles, truly encapsulating the spirit of Serie A football.

The first half kicked off with AS Roma initiating the play at exactly 00:01. Early possession changes dominated the first few minutes, with the ball going out of play at 00:23. Inter quickly sought to establish their dominance with a corner at 00:38, but their resulting shot went off target at 00:50. AS Roma was quick to clear any danger at 01:16. As play continued, both teams grappled for control, resulting in a series of balls out of play and throw-ins.

AS Roma soon showcased their attacking prowess. At 02:09, they won a corner. However, this effort was disrupted, and the ball went out of play again at 02:11. Another corner for AS Roma at 02:28 ended with a foul against them, breaking their momentum.

Inter tried to mount their own attacks, but Roma's defense stood resolute, clearing the danger at 04:13. The home side's efforts paid off at 04:26 with a shot on target leading to the match's first goal. The goal, which came just 4 minutes and 26 seconds into the game, saw AS Roma take a crucial early lead, sending their fans into raptures.

Inter, undeterred, resumed play with the kickoff at 05:23. As the match progressed, both teams exchanged clearances and throw-ins. However, the game was far from static. Inter earned a free-kick at 10:54 following a foul by Alessandro Florenzi of AS Roma. Inter's shot on target from the free-kick at 11:17, taken from 25 meters out by Ever Banega, was thwarted by the Roma defense.

Antonio Candreva of Inter tried to capitalize on a corner at 11:46 but was effectively neutralized by Wojciech Szczesny, who snuffed out the attack at 12:57. Roma responded with their own opportunity in the 13th minute but failed to convert. Diego Perotti burst into the penalty area, only to direct his shot well wide of the target at 13:46.

Inter continued to press, with Candreva once again in the thick of the action. However, he was repeatedly frustrated by solid defensive displays from Roma. The match saw a flurry of activity around the 15-minute mark, with both sides exchanging throw-ins, clearances, and brief moments of possession. Inter's Cristian Ansaldi whipped in a promising cross at 16:08, but it was unsuccessful in finding a teammate.

Roma's attacking intent was clear, with Mohamed Salah finding himself offside at 16:35. Ever Banega tried his luck from long range in the 18th minute, but his effort went well wide of the right post. Salah almost doubled Romaâ€™s lead at 20:18 after receiving a fantastic pass and shooting from close range, but the ball crashed against the post.

The home side did not relent. Salah again forced a fine save from Interâ€™s goalkeeper Samir Handanovic at 21:00. For Inter, Ivan Perisic produced a dangerous low pass into Romaâ€™s penalty area, which earned them a corner at 21:56, but this opportunity was wasted as the ball was cleared by the first man.

Tempers flared when Davide Santon of Inter received a yellow card at 23:39 following a tackle. Federico Fazio missed a great header opportunity for Roma shortly after the resulting free-kick. Both teams continued to exchange attacks and moments of defensive solidity.

Romaâ€™s intensity did not drop. Edin Dzeko's attempt at goal in the 27th minute was denied by Handanovic, maintaining the narrow lead. Interâ€™s persistence paid off in the 41st minute, forcing a corner after Szczesny made a brilliant save to deny a strike from Candreva.

The first half concluded with a closely contested match, exhibiting both sidesâ€™ tactical battles and defensive resilience. The final moments of the half saw another injury scare for Interâ€™s Cristian Ansaldi, which he managed to shake off.

The second half began with renewed vigor from both teams. Inter was quick off the blocks, but defensive discipline from Roma kept them in check. Romaâ€™s Diego Perotti almost increased their lead with a solo effort at 07:22, only for Handanovic to produce yet another astonishing save.

Inter made an early substitution with Assane Gnoukouri coming on for Joao Mario at 14:37. Salah continued to trouble Interâ€™s defense, taking shots and creating opportunities. However, it was Interâ€™s Mauro Icardi who turned provider for Ever Banega at 26:29, leveling the score with a well-placed strike in the bottom right corner.

AS Roma responded magnificently. Edin Dzeko capitalized on a strong team move to restore Roma's lead at 30:43. This goal proved to be decisive, re-establishing Romaâ€™s one-goal advantage.

Inter intensified their efforts to find another equalizer, dominating possession with patient build-up and looking to exploit any defensive gaps. However, Romaâ€™s defense held firm. Despite controlling significant ball possession, Inter struggled to find a clear path to goal.

In the dying minutes of the match, Interâ€™s efforts bore no fruit. Roma introduced fresh legs, with substitutions bringing on Radja Nainggolan and Leandro Paredes for Alessandro Florenzi and Diego Perotti, respectively. The last few minutes saw some nervy moments as Inter tried to press forward and Roma aimed to solidify their defense.

The match ended at 48:13 with a full-time whistle from the referee. AS Roma walked away victorious, clinching a hard-fought 2-1 win over Inter. The game had been a thrilling display of Serie A football â€“ showcasing individual brilliance, tactical awareness, and resilience from both teams.

In summary, this match not only highlighted AS Roma's ability to capitalize on their chances but also underscored Inter's determination and skill. The players' performances, moments of sheer magic, and collective tactical battles made this encounter a memorable spectacle for fans and neutral viewers alike. This tightly contested match will undoubtedly be remembered as a classic, embodying the essence of top-tier Italian football.
